page.title: 18THE TELEVISION RECEPTION
page.content: Eight years ago with the help of the BBC and a contractor organised by locals a cabled system of TV and VHF radio was installed at the cost of the villagers assisted by a local authority grant. A receiving mast was erected on the hill behind the village to obtain signals transmitted from a mast on Mull. The cable is wearing out so again with the advice of the BBC and funded as before, a new system of TV signals transmitted by three active deflectors through the air to aerials on the individual houses is being installed. The deflectors will get their signals from the existing mast which is being modified to obtain a better and stonger signal from the VHF television station at Dalmally. This time the work is being done by a local resident with the help of his troop of Venture Scouts.
